message: /* Recent years: 2000–present */ Turner's new book "Happiness Becomes You"
/* Books */ Happiness Becomes You: A Guide to Changing Your Life for Good by Tina Turner
Aligning text with the content of Makiguchi's biography
/* Early 1980s US national tours */ date correction
/* Erwin Bach */ The year was 1986; the place was Heathrow airport, as Tina described to Oprah Winfrey.
Referenced from Columbia University's Center for Promoting Ideas & Journal of Humanities and Social Science
Clean up and modifications for clarity

Undid revision 907327701 by [[Special:Contributions/PeepleLikeYou|PeepleLikeYou]] ([[User talk:PeepleLikeYou|talk]]) There are no NPOV sources related to this subject in English or Japanese / There are no sources cited on the Japanese Wikipedia about this subject / See Talk
Nichiren Buddhism is the correct term.
Multiple sects claim lineage in the Nichiren tradition
Almost none of this material cites any sources

Removing highly biased / unreferenced material -- this is not an advertisement or a platform to post your personal interpretations of what you believe the subject might have thought or said without any references to support.  NPOV material only please.
Original research throughout lacking NPOV references
Cannot find this in any reliable source; only seen in one gossip post on Reddit; please don't use Reddit chats as Wikipedia material
Please don't post "schedules" of religious activities or new building openings on Wikipedia
Removed text that isn't found in the cited reference material and cannot be found in any other reliable source.
Text description in this article doesn't match original photo text; could be from one of many different Buddhist traditions.
Removed text that's contradicted by the cited reference material; please refrain from adding text that's contradicted by the reference material
Please don't use the subject's own promotional materials as citations
/* List of High Priests of Nichiren Shōshū */ Fixed typo

/* The Soka Gakkai (Value Creation Society) */ The cited material contradicts this content
/* Religious practices */ This image doesn't specify a sect to which its related; many sects use the same style of beads
/* Daily practice */ the\n\nThis image file doesn't identify geographic location
/* Attacks on the Buddha's statue */ copyedits, punctuation
Removed duplicated material; added orig research tags
/* Buddhist use of Classical Sanskrit */ copyedit for clarification
This article is in desperate need of NPOV third-party sources; virtually every statement in the article is unverifiable from NPOV sources - see Talk
The entire article lacks NPOV references; the subject's own websites are not valid reference sources; deleted some dead links
This article contains original research, and appears to be written by someone closely associated with the subject.
This article has no NPOV citations
Clarification of text by adding more context from sources cited
Rephrasing of "activity" as "practice of Buddhism" for clarity
Issues notices shouldn't be removed until the issues are resolved.
These issue notices shouldn't be removed until they are resolved.
Do not post images marked as "own work" that are not your own work

Revised citations that do not support the text; added requests for citations to support facts; most text in this article lacks any supporting citations, and many citations in this article link to official Nichiren Shoshu websites, not neutral sources
